snippet: A federal judge in Albany ruled that the university was within its rights to expel a student, after her German Shepherd bit another student nine years ago.
abstract: Federal Judge Gary L Sharpe in Albany rules that College of Veterinary Medicine at  Cornell University was within its rights to expel Karen Habitzreuther, whose rescued German shepherd was deemed aggressive by Cornell veterinarian and recommended to be euthanized;  Habitzreuther later filed lawsuit, claiming that university misled her, cost her hundreds of thousands of dollars in additional schooling and moving costs and delayed her dream of becoming veterinarian.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Albany ruled that the university was within its rights to expel a student, after her German Shepherd bit another student nine years ago.

headline.main: Veterinary Student Expelled Over a Pet Loses a Court Fight With Cornell
headline.print_headline: Veterinary Student Expelled Over a Pet Loses a Court Fight With Cornell
